008 *******************************************************************************/
009package Ch08_BinaryRegions;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
012import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.requestSampleImage;
013import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
014import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
015
016import java.awt.Color;
017import java.util.List;
018
019import ij.IJ;
020import ij.ImagePlus;
021import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
022import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
023import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
024import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
026import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
027import imagingbook.common.regions.BinaryRegion;
028import imagingbook.common.regions.RegionContourSegmentation;
029import imagingbook.core.plugin.IjPluginName;
030import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
031
032/**
033 * <p>
034 * ImageJ plugin, shows each region's major axis as a vector scaled by the
035 * region's eccentricity. See Sec. 8.6 of [1] for additional details. Also
036 * demonstrates the use of the region property scheme, i.e., how to assign
037 * numeric properties to regions and retrieve them afterwards. Requires a binary
038 * image. Zero-value pixels are considered background, all other pixels are
039 * foreground. Display lookup tables (LUTs) are not considered. Results are
040 * drawn into a new image (pixel graphics), the original image is not modified.
041 * </p>
042 * <p>
043 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
044 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
045 * </p>
046 * 
047 * @author WB
048 * @version 2020/12/17
049 */
050@IjPluginName("Major Axis Demo")
051public class Major_Axis_Demo implements PlugInFilter {  // TODO: convert to overlay display
052        
053        /** Scale of the axis length. */
054        public static double AxisLength = 50;
055        /** Color used to draw regions' centroids. */
056        public static Color CenterColor = Color.blue;
057        /** Color used to draw regions' major axes. */
058        public static Color MajorAxisColor = CenterColor;
059        /** Line width used to draw regions' major axes. */
060        public static int LineWidth = 1;
061        
062        private ImagePlus im;
063        
064        /**
065         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image
066         * is currently open.
067         */
068        public Major_Axis_Demo() {
069                if (noCurrentImage()) {
070                        requestSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.ToolsSmall);
071                }
072        }
073        
074        @Override
075        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
076                this.im = im;
077                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES; 
078        }
079
080        @Override
081        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
082                
083                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
084                        IJ.showMessage("Plugin requires a binary image!");
085                        return;
086                }
087                
088                // perform region segmentation:
089                RegionContourSegmentation segmenter = new RegionContourSegmentation((ByteProcessor) ip);
090                List<BinaryRegion> regions = segmenter.getRegions(true);
091
092                // calculate and register certain region properties:
093                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
094                        calculateRegionProperties(r);
095                }
096                
097                // create the output (color) image:
098                ColorProcessor cp = ip.convertToColorProcessor();
099                cp.add(200);    // brighten
100                
101                // draw major axis vectors (scaled by eccentricity): 
102                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {
103                        if (r.getSize() > 10) {
104                                Pnt2d xc = r.getCenter();
105                                int u0 = (int) Math.round(xc.getX());
106                                int v0 = (int) Math.round(xc.getY());
107                                
108                                double dx = r.getProperty("dx");
109                                double dy = r.getProperty("dy");
110                                int u1 = (int) Math.round(xc.getX() + AxisLength * dx);
111                                int v1 = (int) Math.round(xc.getY() + AxisLength * dy);
112                                
113                                drawCenter(cp,  u0,  v0);
114                                drawAxis(cp, u0, v0, u1, v1);
115                        }
116                }
117                
118                // display the output image
119                new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle() + "-major-axis", cp).show();
120        }
121        
122        private void calculateRegionProperties(BinaryRegion r) {
123                // calculate central moment mu11, mu20, mu02:
124                Pnt2d xctr = r.getCenter();
125                double xc = xctr.getX();
126                double yc = xctr.getY();
127                double mu11 = 0;
128                double mu20 = 0;
129                double mu02 = 0;
130                for (Pnt2d p : r) {
131                        double dx = (p.getX() - xc);
132                        double dy = (p.getY() - yc);
133                        mu11 = mu11 + dx * dy;
134                        mu20 = mu20 + dx * dx;
135                        mu02 = mu02 + dy * dy;
136                }
137                
138                double A = 2 * mu11;
139                double B = mu20 - mu02;
140                
141                double normAB = Math.sqrt(sqr(A) + sqr(B));
142                double scale = sqrt(2 * (sqr(A) + sqr(B) + B * sqrt(sqr(A) + sqr(B))));
143                
144                double dx = B + normAB;
145                double dy = A;
146                
147                r.setProperty("dx", dx / scale);
148                r.setProperty("dy", dy / scale);
149                
150                // --------------------------------------------------
151                
152                // calculate 2 versions of eccentricity:
153                double a = mu20 + mu02;
154                double b = Math.sqrt(Math.pow(mu20 - mu02, 2) + 4 * mu11 * mu11);
155                r.setProperty("ecc1", (a + b) / (a - b));
156                r.setProperty("ecc2", (Math.pow(mu20 - mu02,  2) + 4 * mu11 * mu11) / Math.pow(mu20 + mu02, 2));
157        }
158        
159        private void drawCenter(ImageProcessor ip, int uc, int vc) {
160                ip.setColor(CenterColor);
161                ip.setLineWidth(LineWidth);
162                ip.drawRect(uc - 2, vc - 2, 5, 5);
163        }
164        
165        private void drawAxis(ImageProcessor ip, int u0, int v0, int u1, int v1) {
166                ip.setColor(MajorAxisColor);
167                ip.setLineWidth(LineWidth);
168                ip.drawLine(u0, v0, u1, v1);
169        }
170
171}
